abstract: Update | 6:03 p.m. A group representing Chrysler‘s biggest lenders has pushed back against the Obama administration’s demands for a restructuring of the company’s secured debt, offering instead to take a smaller discount on their loans while taking a 40 percent equity stake in the carmaker, people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:03 p.m. A group representing Chrysler‘s biggest lenders has pushed back against the Obama administration’s demands for a restructuring of the company’s secured debt, offering instead to take a smaller discount on their loans while taking a 40 percent equity stake in the carmaker, people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
